creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: two crisscrossed flutes or whistles forming X at center, overlapping vertical musical staff with treble clef; two stylized cherubs sitting on fluttering ends of a banner over the center flutes, each playing an instrument; at top, putto sits on a wreath and holds a burning torch
marks:
Signature, Inscription, Stamp

-- inscribed in p initialed in red pencil below platemark, at center
medium: Etching on steel on heavy laid paper
provenance: Léon Bournisien, probably sold to Alain Labat, May 14-15, 1984; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Les Mirlitons (Pour Madame Anna Judic)
